intro: Mammillaria pachythele, commonly known as the Pachythele mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white to pale blue spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for succulent collections.
